description: Jamaica, circa 18th century. From Bube dupe (“ghost”) (compare Akan adɔpe).

entries.meaning: (Caribbean, Jamaica) A ghost or spirit, often appearing in the form of a dog barking or howling through the night.
(Jamaica, games) A drawn game of noughts and crosses (in Jamaica tii-taa-tuo).

verbs.description: duppy (third-person singular simple present duppies, present participle duppying, simple past and past participle duppied)

entries.meaning: (MLE, MTE, transitive) To kill; to murder.
examples: He refers to his intention to kill a schoolgirl pregnant with Jolie's unborn baby – who the pair believe is giving Jolie undue hassle. "I'll get da fiend to duppy her den," he writes.

entries.meaning: (MLE, by extension, transitive) To excel in.
